She was the second woman to win an Academy Award

for Best Directing in 2021 for Nomadland,

eleven years after Kathryn Bigelow won it.

Kathryn Bigelow

She was the first woman to win an Academy Award

for Best Directing in 2010 for The Hart Locker.

Susanne Bier

She was the third woman to win an Academy Award

for International Feature Film in 2011 for the Danish

movie In a Better World. No other woman has received

this award in the last decade.

2021

2000

Caroline Link

She was the second woman to win an Academy Award

for International Feature Film in 2003 for the German movie

Nowhere in Africa. Before this, Dutch director Marleen Gorris

was the only woman who had previously received this award.

95.5% of nominees for Best Directing are men

and 4.5% are women. On the other hand, 85,7%

of nominees for International Feature Film are men,

while 14,3% are women.
